title: Hiding critical messages from git-annex about crippled things
body:
I could be the one to be blamed of cause for enabling parallel `get` by default.  Even with the most recent git annex (7.20200204-g4db801d) it doesn't work "smoothly" for ssh connections requiring authentication.
```shell
(conda-20200210-datalad) [d31548v@discovery7 1021_actions]$ git config annex.crippledfilesystem
true

(conda-20200210-datalad) [d31548v@discovery7 1021_actions]$ datalad --version
datalad 0.12.2.dev289

(conda-20200210-datalad) [d31548v@discovery7 1021_actions]$ datalad get sub-sid000052
Total:   0%|                                                                                                                                                                                           | 0.00/2.98G [00:00<?, ?B/s]yohtest@rolando.cns.dartmouth.edu's password: yohtest@rolando.cns.dartmouth.edu's password: yohtest@rolando.cns.dartmouth.edu's password: yohtest@rolando.cns.dartmouth.edu's password: yohtest@rolando.cns.dartmouth.edu's password: yohtest@rolando.cns.dartmouth.edu's password: yohtest@rolando.cns.dartmouth.edu's password: ...^C
(conda-20200210-datalad) [d31548v@discovery7 1021_actions]$ git annex get -J 2 sub-sid000052
get sub-sid000052/ses-actions1/anat/sub-sid000052_ses-actions1_acq-MPRAGE_T1w.nii.gz get sub-sid000052/ses-actions1/fmap/sub-sid000052_ses-actions1_acq-25mm_magnitude1.nii.gz (from origin...) 

  You have enabled concurrency, but ssh connection caching is not enabled. This may result in multiple ssh processes prompting for passwords at the same time.

  This repository is on a crippled filesystem, so unix named pipes probably don't work, and ssh connection caching relies on those. One workaround is to set GIT_ANNEX_SSH_SOCKET_DIR to point to a directory on a non-crippled filesystem. (Or, disable concurrency.)
(from origin...) 

  You have enabled concurrency, but ssh connection caching is not enabled. This may result in multiple ssh processes prompting for passwords at the same time.

  This repository is on a crippled filesystem, so unix named pipes probably don't work, and ssh connection caching relies on those. One workaround is to set GIT_ANNEX_SSH_SOCKET_DIR to point to a directory on a non-crippled filesystem. (Or, disable concurrency.)
yohtest@rolando.cns.dartmouth.edu's password: yohtest@rolando.cns.dartmouth.edu's password: 
```
so I wonder if we could/should do anything to channel such messages back to the user, otherwise they are hidden away and without `DATALAD_LOG_OUTPUTS` user might not even be informed what and why went wrong.
